00020 #ifndef TLM_CORE_TLM2_TLM_ARRAY_H_INCLUDED_
00021 #define TLM_CORE_TLM2_TLM_ARRAY_H_INCLUDED_
00022 
00023 #include <vector>
00024 
00025 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(SC_WIN_DLL_WARN)
00026 #pragma warning(push)
00027 #pragma warning(disable: 4251) // DLL import for std::string,vector
00028 #endif
00029 
00030 namespace tlm {
00031 
00032 //
00033 // To the LRM writer: the below class is an artifact of the tlm_generic_payload
00034 //                    implementation and not part of the core TLM standard
00035 //
00036 
00037 
00038 // This implements a lean and fast array class that supports array expansion on
00039 // request. The class is primarily used in the tlm_generic_payload class for
00040 // storing the pointers to the extensions.
00041 //
00042 // Individual array elements can be accessed through the [] operators, and the
00043 // array length is returned by the size() method.
00044 //
00045 // The size can be dynamically expanded using the expand(uint) method. There
00046 // is no shrinking mechanism implemented, because the extension mechanism
00047 // does not require this feature. Bear in mind that calling the expand method
00048 // may invalidate all direct pointers into the array.
00049 
00050 
00051 //the tlm_array shall always be used with T=tlm_extension_base*
00052 template <typename T>
00053 class tlm_array
00054   : private std::vector<T>
00055 {
00056     typedef std::vector<T>                base_type;
00057     typedef typename base_type::size_type size_type;
00058 public:
00059 
00060     // constructor:
00061     tlm_array(size_type size = 0)
00062         : base_type(size)
00063         , m_entries()
00064     {
00065         //m_entries.reserve(size); // optional
00066     }
00067 
00068     // copy constructor:
00069     // tlm_array(const tlm_array& orig) = default;
00070 
00071     // destructor:
00072     // ~tlm_array() = default;
00073 
00074     // operators for dereferencing:
00075     using base_type::operator[];
00076 
00077     // array size:
00078     using base_type::size;
00079 
00080     // expand the array if needed:
00081     void expand(size_type new_size)
00082     {
00083         if (new_size > size())
00084         {
00085             base_type::resize(new_size);
00086             //m_entries.reserve(new_size); // optional
00087         }
00088     }
00089 
00090     static const char* const kind_string;
00091     const char* kind() const { return kind_string; }
00092 
00093     //this function shall get a pointer to a array slot
00094     // it stores this slot in a cache of active slots
00095     void insert_in_cache(T* p)
00096     {
00097         //sc_assert( (p-&(*this)[0]) < size() );
00098         m_entries.push_back( p-&(*this)[0] );
00099     }
00100 
00101     //this functions clears all active slots of the array
00102     void free_entire_cache()
00103     {
00104         while(m_entries.size())
00105         {
00106             if ((*this)[m_entries.back()])      //we make sure no one cleared the slot manually
00107               (*this)[m_entries.back()]->free();//...and then we call free on the content of the slot
00108             (*this)[m_entries.back()]=0;        //afterwards we set the slot to NULL
00109             m_entries.pop_back();
00110         }
00111     }
00112 
00113 protected:
00114     std::vector<size_type> m_entries;
00115 };
00116 
00117 template <typename T>
00118 const char* const tlm_array<T>::kind_string = "tlm_array";
00119 
00120 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(SC_WIN_DLL_WARN)
00121 #pragma warning(pop)
00122 #endif
00123 
00124 } // namespace tlm
00125 
00126 #endif /* TLM_CORE_TLM2_TLM_ARRAY_H_INCLUDED_ */
